snippet: Councilman Andy King of the Bronx said he wanted characters to be licensed by the city and to submit to background checks and that he would introduce a bill this week to institute those requirements.
abstract: New York City Councilman Andy King of the Bronx announces legislation to regulate Times Square’s ubiquitous costumed characters and their occasionally aggressive solicitations; says he wants characters to be licensed by the city and to submit to background checks.
lead_paragraph: Councilman Andy King of the Bronx said he wanted characters to be licensed by the city and to submit to background checks and that he would introduce a bill this week to institute those requirements.

headline.main: Councilman to Propose Bill to Regulate Costumed Characters Soliciting in Times Square
headline.print_headline: Councilman to Propose Bill to Regulate Costumed Characters Soliciting in Times Square

keywords.value: New York Artists United for a Smile
keywords.name: organizations
